content.raw:
All the corner cases I came up with worked. I don't want to block this PR, so feel free to merge.

But the different logic for positive and negative numbers makes me uneasy. Especially how one uses `_multiple` but the other doesn't.

There's some detail about mixing int with uint (i.e. http://cpp.sh/5rrvy) which I quite don't grasp. I think we should either change `_multiple` to be `int` or convert it to int before using it in the modulo function.
content.html:
All the corner cases I came up with worked. I don't want to block this PR, so feel free to merge.

But the different logic for positive and negative numbers makes me uneasy. Especially how one uses _multiple but the other doesn't.

There's some detail about mixing int with uint (i.e. http://cpp.sh/5rrvy) which I quite don't grasp. I think we should either change _multiple to be int or convert it to int before using it in the modulo function.
